Receptionist was great despite her having to run the counter and alone.Thank you. üôèüèº ‚ù§Ô∏è

Can‚Äôt say the same for the doctor on duty.

I‚Äôve been coming here for the past 7-8years when i‚Äôm unwell at work and 2-3 different doctors (i think) over the years. Today, my first encounter with the new doctor. All was going great however when I shared my concerns towards the end, the doctor got frustrated suddenly, pressed hard on her keyboard and gave out a sigh. üòî

Dr Chua is caring and takes time to properly understand my concern. She even explained why my condition could have occurred and how I could prevent it from happening again in the future. Very calm and soothing.

However I cannot say the same for the 2 ladies at the counter. I was the only one in the clinic but both appeared like they cannot be bothered with me which is fine but the most amusing thing is they gave me my medication and I left without paying. I only realized I didn‚Äôt make payment after a good 5 minutes when I was almost reaching my office. I rushed back to the clinic and both didn‚Äôt even look up (again, empty clinic). I went to the counter and said I think I forgot to make payment. Then they very calmly check the system and were like, oh yeah, it‚Äôs $xxx how will you be paying? So absurd. It‚Äôs like they don‚Äôt even give a damn about whether patients paid. I wonder how they do their accounting.

was rushing through my consultation. gave me 1 day mc but a lot of medicine expecting me to go work high on all her medications. idk why she made me take blood test instead of a covid test. lastly, made me u-turn back to the clinic when i was alrdy in the mrt cause she forget give me half my medication.
Today is 22 April 2025 and they call to ask for one year ago payment 22 March 2024. Shouldn't they have discovered the lapse in their system earlier?
Doctor was good and very experienced. Thanks Dr
